content: When I first began writing about technology, a modest shelf could actually hold pretty much all the volumes that we now recognized as “tech books” — business-oriented tomes about tech companies, geeky explorations of hardware or software milestones, celebratory 0r scary projections of what our current products will morph to, and one more biography of Steve Jobs. Now they tumble out like doughnuts on a conveyor belt, as zillions of writers covering the field realize that to make a statement they have to go really longform.
